    • Constructor Detail

      • DbRemoteSend

        public DbRemoteSend​(org.qore.jni.QoreObject obj)
        Creates the object as a wrapper for the Qore object

      • DbRemoteSend

        public DbRemoteSend​(DbRemote remote,
                    java.lang.String stream,
                    java.lang.String table_name,
                    java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> options)
             throws java.lang.Throwable
        Constructor taking a com.qoretechnologies.qorus.DbRemote "DbRemote" object for the remote server
        Parameters:
        remote - a DbRemote object
        stream - the system_sqlutil "system.sqlutil service stream" to be used
        table_name - a string with remote table name located in the remote dsconn "datasource"
        options - optional stream-api-options as follows:
        • "block": data block size
        • "loglevel": a default log level option for logging; see LogLevels for valid value
        • "no_remote_timeout": if True the "timeout" option will not be sent to the remote
        • "omit_update": a list of columns to omit when updating for asymmetrical upserts; only valid with the "upsert" stream; if this option is given with other streams, it will be ignored
        • "queue_block_size": the number of blocks to queue for sending before the main data thread will block (default: 2)
        • "queue_timeout": the number of milliseconds to wait for queue data before throwing a "QUEUE-TIMEOUT" exception
        • "timeout": an HTTP socket timeout value in milliseconds; used locally and in the remote for socket I/O and queue operations; default value: "5m"
        • "upsert_strategy": an sql_upsert_strategies "upsert strategy code"; only valid with the "upsert" stream; if this option is given with other streams, it will be ignored
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        Note:
        the explicit or default timeout value here overrides any socket I/O timeout set for the remote connection object

      • DbRemoteSend

        public DbRemoteSend​(DbRemote remote,
                    java.lang.String stream,
                    java.lang.String table_name)
             throws java.lang.Throwable

      • DbRemoteSend

        public DbRemoteSend​(java.lang.String remote,
                    java.lang.String datasource,
                    java.lang.String stream,
                    java.lang.String table_name,
                    java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> options)
             throws java.lang.Throwable
        Constructor taking a string giving the name of the remoteconn "remote connection" for the remote server
        Parameters:
        remote - the name of the remoteconn "remote connection" for the remote server
        datasource - a string with name of the remote dsconn "datasource" to use
        stream - the system_sqlutil "system.sqlutil service stream" to be used
        table_name - a string with remote table name located in the remote dsconn "datasource"
        options - optional stream-api-options as follows:
        • "block": data block size
        • "loglevel": a default log level option for logging; see LogLevels for valid value
        • "no_remote_timeout": if True the "timeout" option will not be sent to the remote
        • "omit_update": a list of columns to omit when updating for asymmetrical upserts; only valid with the "upsert" stream; if this option is given with other streams, it will be ignored
        • "queue_block_size": the number of blocks to queue for sending before the main data thread will block (default: 2)
        • "queue_timeout": the number of milliseconds to wait for queue data before throwing a "QUEUE-TIMEOUT" exception
        • "timeout": an HTTP socket timeout value in milliseconds; used locally and in the remote for socket I/O and queue operations; default value: "5m"
        • "upsert_strategy": an sql_upsert_strategies "upsert strategy code"; only valid with the "upsert" stream; if this option is given with other streams, it will be ignored
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        Note:
        the explicit or default timeout value here overrides any socket I/O timeout set for the remote connection object

      • DbRemoteSend

        public DbRemoteSend​(QorusSystemRestHelper remote,
                    java.lang.String datasource,
                    java.lang.String stream,
                    java.lang.String table_name,
                    java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> options)
             throws java.lang.Throwable
        Constructor taking a com.qoretechnologies.qorus.QorusSystemRestHelper object for the remote server
        Parameters:
        remote - a com.qoretechnologies.qorus.QorusSystemRestHelper object
        datasource - a string with name of the remote dsconn "datasource" to use
        stream - the system_sqlutil "system.sqlutil service stream" to be used
        table_name - a string with remote table name located in the remote dsconn "datasource"
        options - optional stream-api-options as follows:
        • "block": data block size
        • "loglevel": a default log level option for logging; see LogLevels for valid value
        • "no_remote_timeout": if True the "timeout" option will not be sent to the remote
        • "omit_update": a list of columns to omit when updating for asymmetrical upserts; only valid with the "upsert" stream; if this option is given with other streams, it will be ignored
        • "queue_block_size": the number of blocks to queue for sending before the main data thread will block (default: 2)
        • "queue_timeout": the number of milliseconds to wait for queue data before throwing a "QUEUE-TIMEOUT" exception
        • "timeout": an HTTP socket timeout value in milliseconds; used locally and in the remote for socket I/O and queue operations; default value: "5m"
        • "upsert_strategy": an sql_upsert_strategies "upsert strategy code"; only valid with the "upsert" stream; if this option is given with other streams, it will be ignored
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        Note:
        the explicit or default timeout value here overrides any socket I/O timeout set for the remote connection object

    • Method Detail

      • openStream

        public void openStream​(java.lang.String stream,
                       java.lang.String table_name,
                       java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> options)
                throws java.lang.Throwable
        Flushes the current stream and reopens a new stream with the same remote connection and in the same dsconn "datasources" Example: 
        
out.openStream("update", "table2");
        Parameters:
        stream - the system_sqlutil "system.sqlutil service stream" to be used
        table_name - a string with remote table name located in the remote dsconn "datasource"
        options - optional stream-api-options as follows:
        • "block": data block size giving the number of rows per block
        • "timeout": an HTTP socket timeout value in milliseconds; used locally and in the remote for socket I/O and queue operations; default value: "5m"
        • "loglevel": a default log level option for logging; see LogLevels for valid value
        • "no_remote_timeout": if True the "timeout" option will not be sent to the remote
        • "queue_block_size": the number of blocks to queue for sending before the main data thread will block (default: 2)
        • "queue_timeout": the number of milliseconds to wait for queue data before throwing a "QUEUE-TIMEOUT" exception
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • openStream

        public void openStream​(java.lang.String stream,
                       java.lang.String table_name)
                throws java.lang.Throwable
        Flushes the current stream and reopens a new stream with the same remote connection and in the same dsconn "datasources" Example: 
        
out.openStream("update", "table2");
        Parameters:
        stream - the system_sqlutil "system.sqlutil service stream" to be used
        table_name - a string with remote table name located in the remote dsconn "datasource"
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • commit

        public void commit()
            throws java.lang.Throwable
        Commit the remote transaction. It also sends any pending data in the data queue before the commit.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • rollback

        public void rollback​(boolean disconnect)
              throws java.lang.Throwable
        Rollback remote transaction
        Parameters:
        disconnect - a boolean value to keep connection open or close the connection. Connection closing is the default
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        See Also:
        disconnect()
        Note:
        it's normally better to disconnect the connection if an error occurs rather than call rollback() when streaming because if a chunked transfer is interrupted, then HTTP calls will fail anyway, and the remote end will rollback the transaction in any case unless an explicit commit is executed

      • rollback

        public void rollback()
              throws java.lang.Throwable
        Rollback remote transaction and disconnect the connection
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        See Also:
        disconnect()
        Note:
        it's normally better to disconnect the connection if an error occurs rather than call rollback() when streaming because if a chunked transfer is interrupted, then HTTP calls will fail anyway, and the remote end will rollback the transaction in any case unless an explicit commit is executed

      • append

        public void append​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object>[] data)
            throws java.lang.Throwable
        Append data to the ready queue: list Data are sent whenever their count reaches the "block" size. The DB transaction is left open.
        Parameters:
        data - a list with row data to be added. It should follow the expected target format (list of hashes, each list element represents a row and each has the row data).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        Note:
        This class assumes that data submitted with the append() methods is stable; that is, it has the same format and same hash keys, additionally, if there are any SqlUtil operator hashes, that they are identical in every row

      • append

        public void append​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> data)
            throws java.lang.Throwable
        Append data to the ready queue: hash Data are sent whenever the row count reaches the "block" size. The DB transaction is left open.
        Parameters:
        data - a hash with data to be added; can be a single row or multiple rows in column format
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        Note:
        This class assumes that data submitted with the append() methods is stable; that is, it has the same format and same hash keys, additionally, if there are any SqlUtil operator hashes, that they are identical in every row

      • config

        public StreamConfig config()
                    throws java.lang.Throwable
        Returns the configuration object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
